TopicTitle: Percentage of air intake available for jet engines?

Articles.Content: Anyone know of a mod aside from Ferram Aerospace that gives you info on how much air you have available vs. what your engines require to stay lit? Ferram gives you a percentage readout that's handy for pushing the limits on high altitude jet aircraft and knowing how much to reduce throttle as you ascend.

Mechjeb 2 may display the information, it certainly has options for doing it automatically.

Edited May 21, 2013 by EndlessWaves

Unless I'm misunderstanding you this info is available in the default ship resources at launch in the upper right and your engine minimums should be listed in their descriptions.

Edited May 21, 2013 by Albert II

Mechjeb2 can certainly show this. It'll show what the current air input is and what the engines require - I think both at current throttle and max throttle. All measured in kg/s or so. So that's 3 such values you can put in a custom window.
Thanks guys, that did the trick! Much appreciated!
